x0do | relative to Epoxomicin. We therefore chose doses of inhibitor where the effective
r8qt | concentration of the inhibitor was similar to previous studies using Epoxomicin alone and well within the acceptable range of efficacy given how potent Epoxomicin is as a proteasome inhibitor.

7af5 | To test the permeability of our compounds, we incubated primary cortical neurons with iBEp over a time course and prepared both cytosolic and plasma membrane-enriched fractions.
uds2 | Samples were immunoblotted and probed for cytosolic marker Actin and membrane protein GluR One to validate our fractionation. We found specific biotin signal corresponding to
jp0o | covalent inhibition of the proteasome by iBEp only in the membrane fraction, and not in the
akty | cytosol, over a twenty-four hour incubation in primary neurons. As an orthogonal measure of cell
olz9 | penetrance, we tested whether the activity of cytosolic proteasomes was affected by iBEp
5rex | treatment. We subjected cytosolic and membrane fractions from iBEp-treated neurons to LLVY-
hiwi | based proteasome activity assays. Cytosolic proteasome activity remains completely intact from

h0lh | To further validate our neuroproteasome-specific inhibitors, we sought a cellular functional
u5th | readout of whether our cell-impermeant inhibitors affected cytosolic proteasomes. One of the
kelb | most penetrant and robust consequences of total proteasome inhibition is the induction of
xtdb | autophagy as a cellular response mechanism to compensate for the lack of proteasomal
f48k | degradation. To test this, we assayed three autophagy markers, p sixty-two levels,
pg0s | LC3bI/II ratios, and Ulk One levels. Each are robust markers of different steps of autophagy. p sixty-two
aiap | has been demonstrated to be rapidly induced upon proteasome inhibition and LC3bI/II induction is thought to be slower, while Ulk One is important for early phagosome formation. Cytosolic
55v8 | proteasome inhibition has been reproducibly demonstrated to induce a strong increase in p sixty-two
6sol |

xclk | Next, our quantitative proteomics analysis revealed a selective pattern of protein insolubility
pah4 | following neuroproteasome inhibition. We find that only fifty-two proteins become sarkosyl-insoluble
2avs | in response to neuroproteasome inhibition, in contrast with over two hundred fifty proteins
d0nn | increasing in the soluble fraction. To narrow in on this list, we quantitated which
nv44 | proteins show a greater than log-fold change in the insoluble fraction, but showed no change in
l6cw | the soluble fraction. This analysis identified only four proteins which show significant
z8po | increases in the insoluble fraction relative to the soluble fraction (Ckmt One, Tau, Taf fifteen, and
wm8m | Hspb One) and one protein which significantly increases in the soluble fraction and showed no
fmj9 | change in the insoluble fraction (Plk Two). Of note, Taf fifteen has previously been observed in
50jk | detergent-insoluble fractions of brains from Alzheimer's patients, correlated with both Amyloid

n7w8 | Our findings raise the intriguing possibility that a fraction of endogenous mouse Tau becomes
qcfr | sarkosyl-insoluble following neuroproteasome inhibition. We sought to validate these findings
idjq | by immunoblot and extend them to determine if the same principle would hold for human Tau
p07t | isoforms, without pathogenic and aggregation-driving mutations. We therefore cultured primary
deod | mouse cortical neurons from either W T or hTau-KI mice. The entire mouse Mapt sequence
